intro: Willoughbya polystachya, commonly known as the Christmas bell, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It is a member of the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence consisting of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in rainforest or wetland habitats. Willoughbya polystachya is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
